title: Remove the slow from Jayce's melee Q
body:
He already has a speedboost, a hard CC, and a gap closer

He doesn't need to also slow you when he knocks you back and runs away

replies.body: The whole reason why he has all that stuff is because he has no real ult. The same goes for Elise, Udyr, and Nidalee.
None of those champions have nearly as much disengage power as Jayce.

I would really like to state that I do think he needs to be toned down, but i don't think removing that utility is the right option, it's like removing one of rivens dashes in her q, he really needs it. He is a combo based champion, and i would argue is more like riven than he is like Nidalee or Elise.

I know the champion, i know how to counter him, i know what to pick against him.

A. you can stun him before he uses that disengage, if you're gonna face him mid take exhaust over ignite

B. He has strong disengage and stick, so don't pick melee against him, if you have to pick first, then build early armor and health, jayce only has 1 % hp move which for its cooldown isn't that great, the rest of his damage vs tanks relies completely on armor pen or MASSIVE ad, so he'll have to counter build you to beat you

C. He can be ganked if you know how to approach it. Jg waits in tri, when he uses his q then go in, he can only knock back one target, when people build the normal build on him he's really squishy and likely wont have much if any lifesteal

D. Armor again... seriously... armor

E. Armor

F. force him to burn all his mana, tear isn't meta on jayce right now for a good reason, it gimps his early game and he's not a hypercarry outside of very specific builds, if he builds tear early he has sacrificed damage.

G. Randuin's omen is perfect against him, it's a slow, save it for when you gonna kill him.

H. If he builds defences just build more defences

Well, Armor doesn't always fix Jayce problems; his first auto when switching to Mercury Hammer does 20/60/100/140(+40% Bonus AD) bonus magic damage. And his E in Mercury Hammer does 8/10.4/12.8/15.2/17.6/20% of the targets maximum health, plus 100% of Jayce's Bonus AD-- in magic damage. Lightning Field also does 100/160/220/280/340/400(+100% AP) magic damage over 4 seconds. Yes, a lot of his damage is physical, but a decent bit of it is also magical. Not to mention first auto in Mercury Cannon lowers resistances by 10/15/20/25% for 5 seconds.

I disagree, Champions with short cool down gapclosers and strong duelers counter him pretty well. AKA Fiora and Irelia beat him up pretty well, also Olaf(oh god not olaf) is incredibly strong against him. Not all melees are weak against jayce.

Nocturne also does pretty well against him, although there are only like three of us that take him top lane.
I love spellshields

I actually play nocturne top... I think his early game is pretty insane! his level two is insane cheese. I mean, in theory you get qw so huge AS and huge AD buff from other level two's, plus you can negate one of their two spells to give more AS, its insane.

Without the slow, Jayce has terrible stick post q. I wouldn't mind the slow removal if Jayce landed on top of his target but he lands pretty far behind the target, making it almost impossible to get an autoattack off without doing some walking
A champ that can switch between ranged and melee doesn't need stick on top of mobility and hard cc.

That i know, they need to tone down his range mode to switch to melee.

Ranged and Melees are pretty different in terms of identity, and the thing is that Hammer form is really really weak right now, even if he can cast all his skills, it doesn't change the fact that he's squishy and relatively inmobile, his gap closer can be dodged and it can only be cast on targets. In retrospect, his Hammer is unsafe, but a lot of extra damage, hence makes him powerful in 1v1 where his damage is strong from the start, but weak in team-fights where he cant access all his damage. 
They would have to really tone down ranged and really buff hammer to even make it remotely possible for hammer cannon balance due to innate ranged vs melee, and how his kit works.
